TopicTitle: If you were the first person on mars, what would you say?

Articles.Content:
I would continue to say

"That's one small step for a man, one giant leap for man-kind."

And try and keep it a tradition until we've been on every planet in the system.

How about you?

Yeah I would keep it like a tradition so it would be A part of Human culture you know.
technically, it would be "contact" because we landed in the craft, however, on the surface, I would say something like - "Well, we've landed - should we set up base?"

aeiou

john madden!

ebrbrbrbrbrbrbrbrbrbr

Bone estas tio.

or

Mi Ã…Â¡atas tio.

that translates to:

This is good. I love this.

There is also the chance of doing the spok hand and saying We come in peace.
Look at me, mom! I'm jumping!

I would say

Houston.....We have a problem.....THERE'S NO WI-FI!!

*looks around*

Screw this, I'm outta here

*flies back to kerbin*
Australia can into space!

*looks up*

Eat your heart out, Neil Armstrong!

I would say:

"ÃÅ¸Ã‘â‚¬ÃÂ¸ÃÂµÃ‘â€¦ÃÂ°ÃÂ»ÃÂ¸."

Which mostly translates into "We've arrived."

Why this one? Because of the famous phrase by Yuri Gagarin, just from the other side.

You also could say:

"That's one giant leap for man, one colossal jump for mankind."

Or something of that kind.

Edited July 6, 2015 by DestinyPlayer
"Well, here we are"
"now that i'm here, can you bring me a time travel machine so i can get back home ? " (easy one but hey ,'') it will happen)
"I am the first to be on Mars. May I have my chocolate bar now?
I want to be the second person on Mars so I can say "Huh. Where did all the aliens go?" and get away with it.

[quote name='reddwarfiv']"goood mooooorning maaars!"


(try to imagine that in capitals. It won't post it with them.)[/quote]

[B][SIZE=7]Hello Stonehenge![/SIZE][/B]
This first step on Mars makes Neil Armstrong's on Luna look like a afternoon stroll.
Where are are the ayy lmaos?

[quote name='flixxbeatz']something like this
[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hv6rbeolqro[/url][/quote]

i'm dying

"Can you lower the lights, please? They're in my eyes." (referring to the people on the soundstage)

Really, though:

"I can't wait to get back to the internet..."

I'd probably say something along the lines of: "Today marks a significant point in the history of mankind. I have ventured out into a land where no other has set foot before. We as humans should be proud of such an amazing feat we have accomplished together and let this day be a start, to our future in space."

...Though I would say that if I was a successful astronaut brave enough to actually go to Mars! Realistically, I'd be saying stuff like this: "What?! I didn't sign up for this! You said there were cookies... (Sad face) Also my I ask, do I get good Wi-Fi connectivity up here?"

Edited December 1, 2015 by Chano
In your face Neil Armstrong! I landed on (REDACTED) MARS!!! AWW YEAH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

"WAIT WHAT... You sent me HERE on this Rust-Ball of a planet.When You said Mars I thought you meant free Mars bars.*turns to camera*Erm...lets see...Always read contracts! Another 10 months to get back.Well...what better time to slowly descend into madness?"

*Inhales deeply, then exhales noisily*

"Good! There is oxygen on this planet."
To quote Ka D'Argo, "I have to pee."

Them people at NASA.

There all Bakas (Japanese for fool,im not Japanese_)
